com.sun.darkstar.example.snowman.game.entity.view.util
Class ViewManager

java.lang.Object
  com.sun.darkstar.example.snowman.unit.Manager
      com.sun.darkstar.example.snowman.game.entity.view.util.ViewManager

public class ViewManager
extends Manager

ViewManager is a Manager that is responsible for managing all the IView that represent the entities. It should be updated by the Game inside the main game loop.

ViewManager is responsible for all aspects of view management including view creation, retrieving, destruction and update.

ViewManager is invoked when an IEntity is created. It then creates a new IView and invokes DataManager to retrieve the geometry data for the new IView. It is also invoked when an IEntity is destroyed to remove the corresponding IView.

ViewManager maintains all the IView by its base IEntity as the key. This allows the system to mark a particular IView as dirty when its corresponding IEntity has been modified. Since two IEntity are considered 'equal' only if they have the same integer ID number, this helps ViewManager to avoid IView mapping conflicts.

When an IDynamicEntity has been modified, its corresponding IDynamicView needs to be marked as dirty with ViewManager. ViewManager then buffers all the dirty IDynamicView for update during the next cycle.

Version:
Creation date: 06-16-2008 17:02 EST, Modified date: 08-12-2008 11:15 EST
Author:
Yi Wang (Neakor)
